description:
The cover of this fourth 70+ page issue of Colors, comprising five disparate editions in English and one additional language (French, German, Spanish, Japanese, or Italian), establishes race as the issue's theme. Beneath the Colors logo, imprinted in black on a white background, are full-length color photographs of black (left) and white (right) models, posed side-by-side and overlaid by illustrative words (race, attitude, power, etc.) imprinted in red, blue, yellow or green, in English on the right and the second language on the left.

The ensuing features carry out the established theme, as do accompanying photographs: for example, under the rubric "what if...?," full page head shots of Queen Elizabeth, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Spike Lee, John Paul II, and Michael Jackson (pp. 31-35) show both skin color and facial features altered to those of a race other than the subjects' own. In a promotion for the client, a double-page spread shows a photographic view by Oliviero Toscani (unpaginated, between pp. 55 and 56) of two below-the-shirt-cuff hands, white (left) and black (right) handcuffed together. The United Colors of Benetton logo, white sans serif capitals on a green band, is imprinted in the upper right hand corner.
